timeline.message: :art: fixed some sonarqube security hotspots and bugs

:art: added default javafx stylesheets (caspian and modena)
:art: added unit test for vertex type detection and validation
:bug: fixed a couple of issues with type regex strings

:bug: updated PasswordObfuscator and PasswordDeobfuscator to use a secure mode and padding scheme
:art: fixed an incorrect assignment in UndoGraphEditState

oops... i forgot to all all files in the last commit...
:bug: updated PasswordObfuscator and PasswordDeobfuscator to use a secure mode and padding scheme
:art: fixed an incorrect assignment in UndoGraphEditState
:art: renamed scatter arrangement to "Scatter 3D" and updated arrangement menu ordering

:art: fixed a minor typo
:art: updated to latest JRE11 (in a previous commit)

timeline.bodyText: If there isn't any change to this file besides the timestamp, please exclude this file from the commit. It does not add any value.
timeline.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: I'm definitely going to forget to do this in the future... is it really an issue?
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText:
There is definitely no harm done if you continue to do so - it's just pointless seeing a timestamp change for someone reviewing it.
I personally get into the habit of doing a git status and then discard this file, then do a git diff before pushing changes through to make sure everything makes sense.
replies.author: arcturus2

timeline.bodyText: We need the JavaFX bundle. Please revert or fix this line and others where you have changed it to the wrong JRE.
timeline.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: Oh I didn't realise they had non-fx bundles - updated.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: @cygnus-x-1 just curios to know if you have swapped the Linux and MacOSX blocks  - I'm not sure of the reason this section was changed and trying to understand the diff.
timeline.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: The two blocks traded places - no reason other than that ordering made sense to me while i was editing things. There should be no functional difference to the script.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: This is interesting. I didn't know we had to add this jar to work. I'll assume this was based on testing you did. Thanks!
timeline.author: arcturus2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -79,7 +80,7 @@ public static CharSequence deobfuscate(final ObfuscatedPassword pwd) {
      * constellation\CoreSecurity\build\classes on the command prompt and run
      * the following command:
      * <pre>
-     * java -cp . au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.security.password.PasswordDeobfuscator
+     * java -cp {path/to/org-openide-util-lookup.jar};. au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.security.password.PasswordDeobfuscator

replies.bodyText: The lookup service is used for discovering the secret key (and now init vector) needed to encrypt/decrypt.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.message: :art: updated build script with the correct jre references

timeline.author: arcturus2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,425 @@
+/*

+ * and open the template in the editor.

timeline.bodyText: @cygnus-x-1 i don't get why we need to do this. I tested undo and redo and it works fine in this PR but doing a forEach inside the for loop is going to be a performance hit and feels unnecessary. objectMap gets added to in addObject().
timeline.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: addObject is irrelevant here as the intention here is to construct the class from a previous state. I get what I was going for here, as objectMap was not being initialized properly, but I'm not sure why I did it this way when I could have just added each entry to objectMap alongside classMap. This is a bug (that we didn't notice because it's not used), but I'll update it to a more efficient implementation.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.message: :art: changes based on pull request feedback
